runs.comm: Kallis gets off the mark by tucking the first ball towards midwicket
a bit of turn for McCullum, on the pads, tucked towards square leg
glanced down to fine leg for a single
played with soft hands towards point, Ryder races across but the batsmen were quick enough to steal a single
down the leg side, extra bounce worries Hopkins
makes room and cuts firmly but can't beat Styris at point
this time Kallis plays it to the right of Styris to get time to take a single
length ball and wide, Kallis looks to flay it through cover, mishits firmly towards the bowler, Bond fields with his boot
short ball, Kallis goes for the pull, the top-edge flies over the keeper for six, that's becoming an increasing common sight in Twenty20s
played towards backward point, where Ryder swoops onto the ball and throws down the stumps at the non-striker's end, but only after Kallis completes the run
length ball just outside off, clipped towards midwicket for an easy single
Shot! back of a length, a bit of width, gets a touch forward and then leans back to carve it past a diving backward point
same length, but on middle stump, nudged towards square leg for a single
defended towards midwicket by Kallis
short ball, McCullum escapes as Kallis can't beat mid-on
outside off, dabbed towards backward point
short again, Smith swivels as he plays it out towards deep midwicket
big appeal for lbw after Kallis is struck on the pads, but that seemed to be heading down leg
what a hit from Kallis, gets on one knee and swings that one over wide long-on for six
length ball on middle and off, mistimed towards mid-off
angling across Smith, who guides the ball down to third man for a single
short of length and just outside off, Kallis pokes it towards third man
Bond belts out an lbw appeal, but that was pitching outside leg, Smith was looking to play it towards the leg side, but misses
Smith jumps a foot outside leg and then looks to beat mid-on, but the timing isn't good enough to beat the man
this time he gets a boundary, muscled to his favourite midwicket region for four for his first hit to the rope
short of length on offstump, watchfully defended to the off side
chopped down to third man for a single
back of length, Smith swings it wide of mid-on for four, it was not too short, but Smith flat bats it for four more
worked to deep backward square leg this time, scrambles back for the second
a bit of swing for Southee, who strikes with a not-particularly-good delivery, fullish on the pads, Smith hoicks it to deep midwicket where Guptill pouches the catch
shortish and just outside off, Kallis tips it towards third man and gets a single
length ball on off, Kallis gets forward and guides to backward point and shouts 'Wait' as the fielder gets onto the ball quickly
stands tall and tucks it towards midwicket for a single
defended just in front of point by Gibbs
Gibbs dances down the track and though he's still not quite to the pitch of the ball, goes through with a lovely lofted off-drive for four
on the pads, nicely timed clip towards wide mid-on
not too short, on middle and leg, Kallis swivels and plays the ball towards midwicket
played with soft hands towards point
flat from Vettori, Gibbs looks to guide to backward point, doesn't get a run
quicker one from Vettori, punched to short cover
massive appeal for lbw as Gibbs bends his knee and goes for the sweep, might have been hit just outside off, Hawk-Eye says he was hit in front of off
turned towards midwicket, 'Let's go' Gibbs shouts to Kallis as he wants the second, but there's no time for two
turned towards short fine leg for a single
nicely clipped towards square leg for a single
slow ball, short of length outside off, defended towards point
another single, this time to third man, not much room but Kallis manage to manoeuver the ball to third man
Gibbs looks to flat the ball to long-on, badly mistimed, but wide of mid-on

What a catch by Southee, as good as the one Tait took yesterday at third man, Kallis played a good-looking uppercut to a shortish ball, the ball flew to the right of third man, Southee hared across and dived to pluck a low two-handed catch
punched off the front foot towards extra cover
de Villiers nearly foxed by that one, he was coming down the track, Vettori bow;ls it flat and short, de Villiers has to adjust late to defend
tickled towards short fine
slapped to long-on by Gibbs for two
defended off the front foot towards extra cover
whipped down to long-on for two
cut off the back foot, can't beat the man at point
short of length ball outside off, Gibbs looks to dab to third man, misses the ball
tucked towards square leg this time
the bat turns in de Villiers' hand as he tries to play the ball to leg, ends up going behind square leg
swung away to deep square leg by Gibbs
Styris is keeping it steady here, short of length, in the channel, defended towards point
length ball on off, played with soft hands towards backward point for a quick single
Vettori continues to keep the runs down, defended back to the bowler
a touch short, on off, carved towards point
fuller this time, de Villiers makes room and guides it in front of point
backs away and taps it towards cover
solid over from Vettori so far, short and on middle, de Villiers was charging out, forced to adjust late, can only defend that one
played off the back foot in front of point for a single, Vettori 3-0-13-0
length ball outside off, punched towards mid-off
similar delivery goes to a completely different part of the ground, Gibbs paddle-sweeps to third man
paddled to fine leg for a couple, sprinted the first to ensure there's time for the second
stunning placement from de Villiers, there was a bit of width on offer, he steered that one between backward point and short third man with hardly any effort, wonderful timing
on the pads this time, blocked towards the leg side
driven down to long-on for a single to end the over
length ball on offside, batsman shuffled across the stumps to tickle it down to fine leg
short of length just outside off, mistimed chip takes the ball over mid-on
superb shot from Gibbs, that's what he's in the team for, a length ball on middle and off, Gibbs gets forward and a clean swing sends the ball towards the sightscreen for six
rocks back and carves it towards cover
a yorker heading for legstump, de Villiers can only dig it out to the bowler
length ball just outside off, de Villiers content to drive down to long-off for a single
cut away towards point for a single
a flat six from Gibbs, he's hitting top gear here, bends his knee and sweeps powerfully over midwicket
jinxed him, Gibbs is gone, he looks to repeat the stroke, but gets a top edge to a legstump delivery, Brendon McCullum runs across from midwicket to take a simple catch near square leg
de Villiers rocks onto the backfoot and tips the ball towards cover for a single
Albie's off the mark by punching towards long-on
shortish ball angling outside off, de Villiers jumps across and whips it towards midwicket to bring up the hundred
played towards midwicket for a single
length ball heading for off, defended back to the bowler

Albie Morkel was nearly a goner there, he looks to swing over long-off, gets a bit of an outside edge to that full delivery, still enough power to take it over the rope, Guptill was a few metres inside the rope, might had been able to latch onto that if he was on the edge
eased down to long-on for a single
Vettori finishes with a quicker ball heading for middle and leg, defended by de Villiers
Albie makes room and guides the ball towards short third man for a single

lovely hit from de Villiers, that was a short ball, but it stayed low, de Villiers opened himself up by getting the front leg out of the way, had to adjust to the bounce, still swung that powerfully over long-on
played towards silly mid-on for a single this time
Albie is content chopping an offstump ball to short third man for a single
de Villiers looking to get a move on here, attempts to repeat the shot that fetched him six earlier in the over, mishit this time but it lands safely between long-on and deep midwicket
low full toss just outside off, Albie shows his strength, swings it over long-off for six
turned towards midwicket for a single
a yorker from Southee, just outside leg, de Villiers backs away, the ball strikes his pad after beating his bat, Hopkins has no chance after that deflection
Southee keeps it full, on middle and leg, turned to midwicket
low full toss on middle, Albie Morkel swings with no timing on that to long on
another single to long-on to complete the over
makes room and slices a short of length ball towards cover
same length on leg stump, swung hard to deep midwicket by Albie
Nathan McCullum drops a sitter, de Villiers flatbats the ball to long-on, waist-high chance for McCullum, should have taken that but it hits him high on the hands
full and just outside off, lashed down to long-off for a single
a full toss, de Villiers says than you and powers that over wide long-on for six, easy put away that
a low full toss outside off to end the over, de Villiers bends his knee as he flatbats it along the ground to long-off
Ab de Villiers tries something innovative, looks to scoop over the keeper's but he gets the ball on the bottom of the bat, and it pops towards square leg
and the a-six-every-over trend continues, this one is in the slot, Albie loves hitting over long-on, which he where he deposits it this time
again to long-on, but along the ground this time, de Villiers hares back for the second
the Morkel show continues, a very low full toss outside off, Morkel reaches across and clubs it straight down the ground for six more
looks to send that one in orbit as well, but misses another full ball outside off
Morkel gets his fifth six, he's not interested in fours, again its straight, Southee striving for the yorker, errs again, it's full, but not so full that Morkel can't get under it
de villiers dances away from leg, swings the ball to long-on, reaches the fielder on the bounce
a slow bouncer from Bond, good thinking that, Morkel looks to carve it towards point but misses, Hopkins doesn't collect cleanly and a bye is taken
de Villiers gets on one knee and slices the ball toward sweeper cover, a diving Martin Guptill keeps the ball from reaching the boundary
back of length ball just outside off, de Villiers wanted to send that out of the stadium, but he doesn't connect with a huge swipe, thinks of a bye but decides against it
shorter this time and outside off, de Villiers misses again, this time they go for the bye, Albie is run out by a direct hit from Hopkins, end of just the innings he's in the team for
Boucher looks to paddle the final delivery past the keeper, they get a single after he fails to connect, what a final over from Bond, just five from it
